meanings.definition: The art or technique of dramatic composition and theatrical representation.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the dramaturgy of the scenes was carefully planned to create a powerful impact on the audience.
meanings.sent2: The dramaturgy of the Shakespearean play showcased the playwright's skill in crafting compelling narratives.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturgy of the comedy had everyone laughing from start to finish.
meanings.sent4: Her life was like a piece of dramaturgy, with unexpected twists and turns at every corner.
meanings.sent5: The dramaturgy of the performance left a lasting impression on all who watched.

meanings.definition: The theory and practice of dramatic writing and production.
meanings.sent1: Studying dramaturgy helps aspiring playwrights understand the principles of storytelling in theater.
meanings.sent2: The dramaturgy of the play involved both the creative writing process and the logistical aspects of staging.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturgy class was so engaging that even the most reluctant students found themselves enjoying it.
meanings.sent4: His approach to problem-solving was like the dramaturgy of a well-crafted play, with each step leading to a satisfying resolution.
meanings.sent5: The dramaturgy of the film industry involves a delicate balance between artistic vision and commercial success.

meanings.definition: The study of dramatic composition and the representation of the main elements of drama on the stage.
meanings.sent1: Her thesis focused on the historical development of dramaturgy in Western theater.
meanings.sent2: The dramaturgy of the play was evident in the careful attention to character development and plot structure.
meanings.sent3: The dramaturgy workshop provided valuable insights into the nuances of stagecraft.
meanings.sent4: The dramaturgy of the performance was like a well-orchestrated symphony, with each element harmonizing perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The dramaturgy of the production highlighted the importance of collaboration among actors, directors, and designers.
